result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Gordon Hericks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay restitution and restitution surcharge in an amount to be determined within 10 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall complete 40 hours of community service within 10 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and provide the Monroe County Justice Department, Justice Program Coordinator or designee, with verification of said hours.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Imposed & stayed jail sentences in 15CM552 & 16CM328 consecutive to each other.

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment that meets with agent's approval and not quit employment without agent approval.

AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances except those legally prescribed to defendant and take prescribed medications exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Comply with any recommendations, orders and assessments ordered by agent.

Not eligible for expungement.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
